Authors and Citation
text: Kaye E (2024). warwickplots: Palettes themes consistent University Warwick's brand. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/warwickplots/, https://github.com/Warwick-Stats-Resources/warwickplots.

what: Palettes and themes consistent with The University of Warwick's brand
title: Palettes and themes consistent with The University of Warwick's brand
text: R package colour palettes themes consistent University Warwick’s branding, especially colours typography. palettes built using palettes package.

title: Palettes and themes consistent with The University of Warwick's brand
text: can install development version warwickplots GitHub :

title: Palettes and themes consistent with The University of Warwick's brand
text: plot uses primary palette theme_warwick().  docuementation, see vignette("warwickplots").
code: library(warwickplots) #> Loading required package: palettes library(ggplot2) library(palmerpenguins) ggplot(penguins, aes(flipper_length_mm, body_mass_g, group = species)) + geom_point(aes(colour = species, shape = species), alpha = 0.8, size = 2) + scale_color_palette_d(warwick_palettes$primary) + labs(title = "Penguin Size, Palmer Station LTER", subtitle = "Flipper length and body mass for **Adelie**, **Chinstrap** and **Gentoo** Penguins", caption = "Visualization: Ella Kaye, Data: Gorman, Williams & Fraser (2014) DOI: 10.1371/journal.pone.009008", x = "flipper length (mm)", y = "body mass (g)") + theme_warwick() + theme(legend.position = 'none') #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

what: ggplot2 theme consistent with Warwick Brand — theme_warwick
title: ggplot2 theme consistent with Warwick Brand — theme_warwick

ggplot2 theme consistent with Warwick Brand — theme_warwick
ggplot2 theme consistent with Warwick Brand — theme_warwick
code: if (FALSE) { ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::mpg, ggplot2::aes(cty, hwy)) +    ggplot2::geom_point() +    theme_warwick() }

title: Internal palettes methods — warwick-palettes

what: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: object class palettes_palette 6 colour palettes. Use names(warwick_palettes) return palette names.

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: object class palettes_palette 1 discrete colour palettes. Use names(warwick_palettes_discrete) return palette names.

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: object class palettes_palette 3 sequential colour palettes. Use names(warwick_palettes_sequential) return palette names.

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
text: object class palettes_palette 2 sequential colour palettes. Use names(warwick_palettes_divergent) return palette names.

title: University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
University of Warwick brand palettes — warwick_palettes
code: # Get all palettes by name. names(warwick_palettes) #> [1] "primary"        "aubergine"      "teal"           "ruby"           #> [5] "aubergine_ruby" "aubergine_teal"  # Plot a specific palette plot(warwick_palettes$primary)   #' # Plot all palettes. if (FALSE) { plot(warwick_palettes) }

what: warwickplots: Palettes and themes consistent with The University of Warwick's brand — warwickplots-package
title: warwickplots: Palettes and themes consistent with The University of Warwick's brand — warwickplots-package
text: Colour palettes 'ggplot2' theme consistent University Warwick' branding. Built using 'palettes' package, provides methods printing, formatting, casting coercion, extraction updating components, plotting, colour mixing arithmetic, colour interpolation.

title: warwickplots: Palettes and themes consistent with The University of Warwick's brand — warwickplots-package
